page.title: 09Watermill Farm at Norwell
page.content: { }The farm stands on the outskirts of Norwell village, in 15 acres, with the Beck flowing close by. It is the site of the old{watermill}of which there is now little evidence. {Mrs. Foulds}runs a business from here buying, renovating and selling {tractors.}She employs 2 men and there are about 60 tractors in stock, in various stages of repair. She mainly deals with Ford tractors but does stock some others. She buys tractors by private sale,from dealers, farm sales or auctions. Most of the tractors are exported, mainly to{Third World {Countries. } In order to meet with strict hygiene laws abroad, the tractors must first be steam cleaned, then sand blasted. They are then painted with a rust preventative before spraying.
